info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:05AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Hardin, north central Massac, northern Pope, eastern Johnson and northwestern Livingston Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1105 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dixon Springs, or 7 miles east of Vienna, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dixon Springs around 1115 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Golconda and Joy. This includes Interstate 24 in Illinois between Mile Markers 18 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
